para.b: One of the main classes of the library.

summary.para: This engine is responsable to Read/Write the records at once from/to files or streams.
You can use the or the if you need to change some options at runtime

remarks.para: You can set the of this class when found an error, and can retrive them with the property.
See in the Class Diagram and in the Quick Start Guide for more Info.
Or you can browse the Examples Seccion for more code.

FileHelperEngineCtr.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FileHelperEngine class with the specified type of records.

FileHelperEngineCtrG.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FileHelperEngine class with the specified type of records.

ReadFile.summary: Read a file and return an array of the contained records.
ReadFile.remarks: This method open, read and close the file (don't open or close the file before or after to call this method)
ReadFile.param: The file path to be read.
ReadFile.returns: An array of the records in the file

ReadStream.summary: Read a Stream and return an array of the contained records.
ReadStream.remarks: This method only uses the stream and dont close them after use it, you must do it.
ReadStream.param: The reader of the source stream.
ReadStream.returns: An array of the records in the Stream

ReadString.summary: Read a String and return an array of the contained records.
ReadString.param: The string that contains the records.
ReadString.returns: An array of the records in the String.

AppendToFile1.summary: Append a record to the specified file.
AppendToFile1.remarks: This method open, seek ends, write and close the file (don't open or close the file before or after to call this method)
AppendToFile1.param: The file path to be written at end.
AppendToFile1.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

AppendToFile2.summary: Append an array of records to the specified file.
AppendToFile2.remarks: This method open, seek ends, write and close the file (don't open or close the file before or after to call this method)
AppendToFile2.param: The file path to be written at end.
The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
AppendToFile2.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

WriteFile.summary: Write an array of records to the specified file.

remarks.para: This method open, write and close the file (don't open or close the file before or after to call this method)

WriteFile.param: The file path to be write.
The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
WriteFile.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

WriteFile2.summary: Write the specified number of records from the array to a file.

remarks.para: This method open, write and close the file (don't open or close the file before or after to call this method)

WriteFile2.param: The file path to be write.
The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
The max number of array elements to write.
WriteFile2.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

WriteStream.summary: Write an array of records to the specified Stream.
WriteStream.remarks: This method only uses the stream and don't close them after use it, you must do it.
WriteStream.param: The writer of the source stream.
The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
WriteStream.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

WriteStream2.summary: Write the specified number of records in the array to the Stream.
WriteStream2.remarks: This method only uses the stream and don't close them after use it, you must do it.
WriteStream2.param: The writer of the source stream.
The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
The max number of array elements to write.
WriteStream2.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

WriteString.summary: Write an array of records to an String and return it.
WriteString.param: The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
WriteString.returns: The resulting string after write the records.

WriteString2.summary: Write an array of records to an String and return it.
WriteString2.param: The records to write (Can be an array, ArrayList, etc)
WriteString2.returns: The resulting string after write the records.
WriteString2.param: The max number of array elements to write.
WriteString2.returns: True if the operation is successful. False otherwise.

TotalRecords.summary: The total numbers of records in the last read/written file (only works with whole read/write).

RecordType.summary: Returns the type of records handled by this engine.
